result.execSummary:
The defendant John G. Beles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with L.A.B., dob 05/30/2009, without approval of victim's mother and probation agent. No unsupervised contact with minors.
--------------------------------------

Comply with SORP conditions and expectations of program.
--------------------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
--------------------------------------

records.addlTxt:
Bond Hearing before the Honorable Phillip Koss on June 22, 2015
Court Reporter Linda Matoska
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing the transcript(s) in this case is extended to October 16, 2017.

Bond Hearing before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on June 22, 2015
Court Reporter Linda Matoska

Status Conference before the Honorable David Reddy on Septemebr 21, 2015
Court Reporter Eileen Grzenia
Original Writ filed with Court

Motion Hearing before the Honorable Davdi Reddy on July 9, 2015
 Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

Arraignment before the Honorable Phillip Koss on July 31, 2015
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

Motion Hearing before the Honorable David Reddy on October 27, 2015
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED
Application for Jail Time Credit form

9:02 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody with attorney Julia Marie May.  
Matter is before the Court for change of plea and sentencing.  
Plea questionnaire is filed with the Court.  
Atty May makes record as to terms of plea agreement.  Atty Donohoo confirms the plea agreement.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with Mr. Beles.  
Defendant enters GUILTY pleas to Cts 1, 2 and 3.  
Mr. Beles agrees that there is a factual basis for the charges.  Atty May so stipulates.  
Court gives warnings with regard to 1) voting 2) firearms 3) deportation. 
Court makes findings, accepts plea and adjudges the defendant guilty of all 3 counts.  
Argument by Atty May in support of the agreement.  
Mr. Beles has nothing further to say.  
Court makes findings and will adopt the joint recommendation.  

SENTENCE:  
Ct 1:  6 years prison:  3 years IC; 3 years ES, concurrent with any sentence now serving;  
Ct 2:  9 months Jail, concurrent with Ct 1 and any sentence now serving;  
Ct 3:  6 years prison:  3 years IC; 3 years ES, concurrent with Ct 1 and any sentence now serving;  
Sentence credit TO BE DETERMINED;
Eligible for CIP and SAP;  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Pay Court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
2)  Maintain employment.  
3)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
4)  No contact with L.A.B. dob 05/30/2009, without approval of victim's mother and probation agent.  
5)  No unsupervised contact with minors.  
6)  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  
7)  Comply with SORP conditions and expectations of program.  

Discussion between Court and Attys concerning sentence credit.  Atty Donohoo believes defendant may have some days of credit on this case.  Atty May will file an Application for Jail Time Credit with the dates he has been in custody on this case.  9:12 am  Court in recess.

Motion Hearing before the Honorable David Reddy on April 7, 2016
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

Motion Hearing before the Honorable David Reddy on April 25, 2016
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

Oral Decision before the Honorable David Reddy on August 5, 2016
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

ADDRESS INFO for John G. Beles
Current: 2700 Mason St, Delavan, WI 53115 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2017)
Prior: 2611 Mason St., Delavan, WI 53115

Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody with attorney Julia Marie May.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Atty Julia May
4/3/2017 E-mails between Attys and Clerk, re:  scheduling of plea and sentencing hearing
Status conference on April 5, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

10:02 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court, in custody with Atty Dudley A. Williams.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Matter is before the Court for sentencing on file 2015CF000163.  
Court notes that it also has file 15CF221 on the calendar for status.  Atty Williams has spoken with his client, and he believes it would be better under the circumstances that another Attorney represent Mr. Beles on that file.  Atty Donohoo has no objection to this and would suggest 15CF221 be put over for a short period of time in order for Mr. Beles to contact the public defender's office.  Court will grant the Motion to withdraw but advises Atty Williams that he will need to submit, via e-filing, a Motion to withdraw as well an Order for the Court's signature.  Court schedules status conference on file 2015CF000221 for March 29, 2017 at 1:15 pm.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  3:28 pm Case called.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant John G. Beles in court with Atty Dudley A. Williams.  
Matter is before the Court for FPT.  File 2015CF000163 will be tried starting on Monday, January 9th.  File 2015CF000221 will continue to track.
of Oral Decision given on August 5, 2016; Court Reporter Sandra Elderbrook

Final pre-trial on January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 9, 2017 at 08:00 am.

** Transcript filed 8/9/16**

Court in session 10:00am
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John G. Beles in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams. 
Court makes findings regarding Dr Woody's testing and the Static 99.  
Daubert factors: Dr Woody is qualified. The testing is reliable. Testing is not relevant, except for the alcohol use disorder.  No need for a Richard AP analysis.
Clarification by ADA Donohoo.
Clarification by Atty Williams.  
Response by the Court.  
Reply by Atty Williams.  
Response by the Court regarding reliability not conclusions generated.     
Response by ADA Donohoo.  
Response by the Court.  
10:24am Court goes off the record to schedule jury trial.  
10:29am Dates not decided.  Clerk will email parties with dates.  
ADA Donohoo to prepare the order.
Court adjourned 10:30am

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/19/2017: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**
Oral ruling on August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John G. Beles in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2015CF163 John Beles 04/25/2016 MH @ 9 am  Court Reporter : Sandy Elderbrook
Court in session at 9:06 am. Appearances made. Defendant in court with Attorney Dudley Williams. Diane Donohoo with Matthew Surridge appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Continued cross exam of Dr. Woody. Objection by Atty Williams. Objection overruled. Exhibit # 18 identified as Coding Rules for RRASOR. Exhibit #19 RRASOR example. Exhibit #10 from 04/07/2016 moved by State. Objection by Atty Williams. Objection Overruled. Exhibit#10 , #18 and #19 received. Exhibit #13 identified as Center for Sex Offender Management. Exhibit #13 moved into evidence. Atty Williams recites a paragraph into the record  from Exhibit #13. Objection by Atty Donohoo regarding Atty Williams addressing article mid cross examination. Exhibit #13 received. Exhibit #14 identified as APSAC handbook and #15 Sports Illustrated Article moved into evidence. Exhibit #14 received. Objection by Atty Williams on receiving  Exhibit #15. Objection overruled and Exhibit #15 received. Exhibit #16 moved into evidence identified as University of Washington of Medicine Article. Objection as to relevance by Atty Williams on Exhibit #16. Exhibit #16 received. Exhibit #17 identified as Sex Offender, Identification, Risk, Treatment and Legal Issues. Exhibit #17 received. Exhibit #20 idd as Sex Offender Treatment.org  and #21 idd as Document from Sex Offender Treatment.org  moved into evidence. Exhibit #20 and #21 received. Atty Williams recites paragraph in Exhibit #21 for completeness. Exhibit #22 identified as Static 99 Timeline. Exhibit #22 received. Court takes short break and will resume at 10:40 am.
 Court back in session at 10:40am. Continued cross exam by Atty Donohoo. Exhibit #25 idd as Delavan Police report. Exhibit #25 received. Atty Williams recites statement for the record from Exhibit #25. Exhibit #23 idd as Dr. Annasalter- Static 99 Blog. Exhibit #23 received. Court asks for factors which are considered dynamics of an offender. Exhibit #24 idd as Static 99 Clearing House and Exhibit #26 Affidavit of Dr. David Thornton. Exhibit #26 and #26 received. Court takes a short break.
10:57 am  Court back in session with Attys and Defendant.  Direct  exam of Dr. Woody by Atty Williams. Objection by Atty Donohoo to Atty Williams question. Objection sustained. Court requests question to be phrased differently. Objection by Atty Donohoo as to relevance. Objection sustained. Objection to form of question by Atty Donohoo. Objection sustained. 11:22 am  Cross exam by Atty Donohoo. Objection by Atty Williams as to relevance. 11:28  Atty Williams makes statement into the record. Oral ruling scheduled for June 30, 2016 @ 8:30 am for 30 minutes.
11:30am  Witness excused. Briefs to be filed with in 30 days.  05/25/2015 Defense, 06/03/2016 State
11:36 am - Motion to Compel filed by Atty Williams.  Discussion as to testimonial. Court denies Motion. Exhibit #27 marked and  from 04/07,2016 Motion Hearing received.
11:47 am  Court in recess.
  Oral ruling scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/19/2017: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**

9:04 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.   
Atty Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft John G. Beles in court with Atty Dudley A. Williams. 
Matter is before the Court on Deft's Motion in Limine to Admit Expert Testimony.  
Court wants to first address the timeliness of the Motion.  
9:05 am  Response by Atty Williams.  
9:12 am  Response by Atty Donohoo requesting that the Motion be heard.  
Court was going to give the State an opportunity to retain its own expert.  
State is going to rely upon the portions to the treastise along with additional exhibits.  
Continued discussion concerning the currently scheduled trial dates.  
Atty Williams did file a Motion regarding use of the video interview of the child.  
Atty Donohoo intends to call the child to the witness stand.  
Discussion between Court and Attys as to use of video interview of child at trial. 
Defense is moving under 908.08 to use the video.  
Court addresses each factor listed in the Statutes.  
Court asks that State provide Court with the CD's.  
If parties don't have a stipulation, the Court will review the CD's and make a ruling.  
9:24 am  Dr. Michael Woody is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Williams.  
Exhibit #1 marked and id'd as copy of Dr. Woody's C.V.
Exhibit #1 is offered and received.  
9:55 am  Court takes recess and will resume at 10:10 am

10:10 am  Court in session.  
10:10 am  Cross exam of Dr. Woody by Atty Donohoo.  
Atty Williams objects to Atty Donohoo being allowed to see the Doctor's notes.  
Atty Donohoo is only asking for the portion relating to the deft's statements.  
Atty Donohoo believes the privilege issue is waived because the Defense brought it up.  
She is not asking the Court to ask the Dr. to produce any notes other than statements made by the deft that night.  
Court will have the Doctor read into the record those notes that the doctor reviewed for his testimony.  
Dr. Woody reads those portions of his notes into the record.  
10:21 am  Continued cross exam of Dr. by Atty Donohoo.
10:24 am  Response by Dr. to Court's questions.  
10:25 am  Atty Williams withdraws his objection.  Dr. Woody responds to State's question.
10:26 am  Continued cross exam by Atty Donohoo.  
10:28 am  Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to State's next Exhibit.  Atty Williams is objecting on relevance grounds.  
Court overrules defense objection to State's Exhibit #3 - Order Excluding Actuarial Instrument RRASOR
Court receives Exhibit #3 into evidence. 
10:31 am  Continued cross exam by Atty Donohoo
Exhibit 4 marked and id'd as Practice Standards and Guidelines
Exhibit 5 marked and id'd as a Publication from Federal Probation  
Exhibit 5 is offered and received.  
Exhibit 4 is offered and received.  
Exhibit 6 is marked and id'd document reference Dr. Salter - summary of her history and her biography 
Exhibit 6 is offered and received.
Exhibit 7 is Quotes from Dr. Salter's work.  
10:55 am  Response by Atty Williams to State's introduction of Exhibit #7.  He is objecting to relevance.
10:55 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
10:57 am  Exhibit 7 is received into evidence.
10:58 am  Continued cross exam of Dr. Woody by Atty Donohoo.  
Exhibit 8 marked and id'd as Study published in the Journal of Sexual Aggression.  
Atty Donohoo moves Exhibit 8 into evidence.  Atty Williams objection.  
Atty Donohoo reads portions of Exhibit 8 into the record.  
Argument by Attorneys relating to Exhibit 8.  
Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  
Court overrules Atty Williams relevance objection and finds that it goes to the weight and not the admissibility.  
Court receives Exhibit 8.  
Exhibit 9 is marked and id'd as the Study by Michael Seto, James Canter and Ray Blanchard.  
Exhibit 9 is offered by State.  Argument by Atty Williams.  
Court receives Exhibit #9 finding that it goes to the weight and not the admissiblity.  
11:21 am  Continued cross exam of Dr. Woody by Atty Donohoo.  
Exhibit 10
11:25 am  Court takes recess and will resume at 11:40 am

11:39 am  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  
11:39 am  Continued cross exam of Dr. Woody.  
11:39 am  Exhibit 11 marked and identifed as a portion of DSM 5.  
Exhibit 2 marked and id'd as Dr. Woody's score sheet used in administering tests
Exhibit 12 marked and id'd as Static 99 Coding Rules

12:11 pm  Court addresses further scheduling of this Motion with the Attys and the witness.  
Court believes it is clear that this Motion won't be resolved prior to the scheduled trial dates.  
Court proposes continuing this Motion to either the first date or 2nd day of what would have been the Jury Trial - 4/25 or 4/26
Atty Donohoo moves Exhibits 11 and 12 into evidence.  Court notes also, Exhibit 2 has not yet been received.  
Exhibits 11, 12 and 2 are received.  

Court continues Motion to Monday, April 25th at 9:00 am.  Court cancels the FPT and JT at this time.  
Atty Donohoo anticipates another hour and a half left of cross examination.  
Atty Williams does not believe he will need more than a hour
Court asks Attys to review the CD recording of the child prior to the next hearing.  
Court is going to strongly consider requiring briefing on this matter.  
Court discusses setting a Motion deadline - Court sets deadline of April 25th.  
12:20 pm  Court in recess.

AMENDMENT 10-27-15 DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH R.B. EXCEPT THEY MAY NOT DISCUSS THE CASE

AMENDMENT 07/09/15 DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED TO ATTEND WEDDING CEREMONY BUT NOT THE RECEPTION. 

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 15GF515 AND 15CF163.  MUST POST $2,500 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH L.A.B. (DOB 05-30-2009) OR L.A.B.'S MOTHER OR THEIR RESIDENCE.  NO CONTACT WITH MINORS.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
